title: How to get free PC parts - Quora

response.answer_text: Local recycling centerBulk pickup day (sidewalk).If the computer is older than a Core 2 Duo, forget it. A Core 2 Duo booting Xubuntu works great as a web browsing machine. Older gear tend to use a lot of electricity. Pentium 4s used 120 watts!. Core 2 Duo and later CPUs (business grade) average 50 watts or less. New computer gear is so cheap now that old parts really aren’t worth recycling. Even older monitors suck .. electricity. Smaller than 19″ — throw it away. LED-backlit LCDs flatscreens use half the the electricity of older CCFL backlit LCDs. Use Kill-A-Watt to determine if something is worth keeping. Yes, the old gear is free, but the electricity it uses may eat you out of house and home.

Go to a random dumpster and do some dumpster diving, go to the dump and see if they’ll let you look around and take some free stuff, or look for people that are upgrading their PCs or getting a new one and ask what they’re doing with their old one, if they say selling it, say thanks but I’m broke (unless you not broke and you actually want to buy it), or if they say they’re throwing it away, ask if you can have it. There is also the way that everyone know, but is illegal (it’s stealing) and is highly frowned upon and not suggested.
